activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 230, Branch 1

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Anthony Serafin

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 1:25 PM Defendant John Anthony Serafin in court.  Attorney Wesley Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant had previously advised that he would be privately retaining counsel. Defendant has not been able to come up with the funds to retain counsel. Defendant must pay $250 deposit by 4/15/2022 then $100 monthly starting 5/1/2022 for court appointed counsel. The Court finds that good cause exists to adjourn the IA.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:11 PM Defendant John Anthony Serafin appeared, in custody, via video with Attorney Emma K Blankschein. Attorney Wesley Kottke for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $1200 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.
Initial appearance scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
